comment.body: @Quadrangle: The newsfeed on ZeroHello allows you to follow your followers back, like a follow-for-follow system.

@Quadrangle: Nofish: "The hubs are not connected, mine is also not real number I only get connected to 3 hubs" -- this means that you will only be connected to a few hubs at a time and rarely all of them at once, meaning you won't be able to retrieve the real follower count easily

@Jayofthezero: My GPU (GTX 960) supports accelerated H.265 encoding/decoding, and it does it smoothly & without even needing to turn the fans on.  2nd gen Maxwell (900 series) GPUs all support NVENC which encodes in H.265 flawlessly.  Here are some (clearnet) links describing speed/efficiency: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fGPgW9TAnFQ, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hRIesyNuxkg

@Jayofthezero: Firefox doesn't support everything fully though.  CSS blurring, some CSS animations, various other features are all left out, which is why I didn't support FF with Bwoi and kept with Chrome.  Opera is nice, and Vivaldi is good too, and I'm not too sure why nobody uses them

I suggest checking out the channel https://www.youtube.com/user/linuxscoop (clearnet fyi) since it showcases many different Linux distros quickly and gives you a brief look of what each one does.  Personally I recommend using something like Deepin (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z8I6FUNpMgM) or Ubuntu MATE (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KEHxHr-Ih9w) since they both use similar environments if you're not into Elementary.
@Lola: Will you ever get previews to work? ;)
Why 100mb? Seems a bit much for a site wth a few torrent links and images?
@Sirenyc: Oh okay.  Why not use .jpegs with compression on the smaller images though?

I had Ubuntu OS on my old Nexus 4 back last year (not much has changed) and it felt quite empty and left a lot to be desired.  The UI/UX was very innovative though and I really wish that they would let Android apps at least run in some shape or form on the OS, because right now there aren't enough apps for me to go "yep, switching to this" at all.  Maybe if they made it easier to port?  Last time I tried making an app it took me twice the time that it would usually do for an Android device, though that was probably due to the fact that I was still getting used to everything (SDK layout, functions etc)
